description.short: Mobile protection system (VAP2) and backend (VAP-DSS) for domestic violence victims with GPS tracking and proximity alerts.
description.full: GEOSATIS Victim App ecosystem consists of VAP2 (mobile app) and VAP-DSS (backend service). VAP2 is a Kotlin Multiplatform app providing real-time location tracking, emergency video recording (2.5 min, S3 upload), one-touch emergency calls, and alarm notifications via GraphQL Subscriptions. VAP-DSS is a Spring Boot backend with dual GraphQL APIs (Victim + Admin), Kafka event streaming, and Firebase Auth. The system triggers alarms when offenders enter victim proximity zones (configurable, typically 2km). Successfully advocated for GraphQL over the unstable Geonitro binary protocol.

challenge.context: Previous Android developer quit. App was not working - location tracking unstable and inaccurate.
challenge.response: Identified root causes and fixed critical issues in the first month to bring system to production-ready state.
details: Poor location tracking code causing unstable and inaccurate data
Custom binary protocol issues - data not saved on server
Socket connection not re-established after server timeout
Local database saving outdated locations
Backend only accepted real-time locations, rejected delayed data

achievements.title: Rescued Failing Project (Month 1)
achievements.problem: Previous developer quit. App non-functional with unstable, inaccurate location tracking.
achievements.solution: Fixed location tracking, socket reconnection, database handling, and coordinated backend protocol improvements.
details: Fixed location tracking stability and accuracy
Implemented socket reconnection logic when no server response
Fixed local database to properly handle real-time vs outdated data
Coordinated with backend team on protocol improvements

impact.text: System went from non-functional to production-ready

achievements.title: Custom Protocol Engineering (Geosap)
achievements.problem: Protocol lacked message delivery confirmation. Data loss was undetectable.
achievements.solution: Reworked entire client-side protocol with retry mechanism and ACK logic.
details: Reworked entire client-side protocol implementation
Added retry mechanism for failed transmissions
Implemented ACK (acknowledgment) logic for delivery confirmation
Provided specifications to backend team for protocol improvements
Data: GPS coords (30s), 5 alarm types, health checks, continuous connection

realWorldImpact.title: Crime Prevention - Seville, Spain (2024)
realWorldImpact.description: The Victim App successfully prevented a crime in Seville before summer 2024. A victim detected her abuser at her house door through the app's proximity alert system. The assigned monitoring agent initially said there couldn't be a threat because there was no system alert - but the victim's app had correctly identified the danger, demonstrating the critical importance of mobile proximity detection.
